title: Requires cigarette manufacturer to disclose chemical additives in cigarettes
summary: Requires manufacturers of cigarettes sold or distributed in the state to disclose additives used in the manufacture of cigarettes and to identify those substances which have been determined to be toxic; provisions made for the health department to investigate the health risks associated with exposure to added constituents, toxic constituents and nicotine and shall develop standards to reduce risks; establishes civil penalty for violations; makes related provisions.

       AN ACT to amend the public health law, in relation  to  requiring  ciga-
         rette  manufacturers  to  disclose the chemical substances used in the
         manufacture of cigarettes

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Legislative findings. It has been the policy of the state
    2  to guarantee and facilitate the public right to know  concerning  health
    3  risks  that  may  be  encountered  from manufactured products and at the
    4  workplace. The legislature finds that literally  thousands  of  chemical
    5  substances  are  routinely  utilized in the manufacture of cigarettes as
    6  burn retardants, preservatives, flavor enhancers and for other aesthetic
    7  purposes and that such chemicals may have toxic effects for both smokers
    8  and nonsmokers. Therefore, the legislature further finds that the public
    9  has a right to know the chemical substances used in the  manufacture  of
   10  cigarettes  and  what  toxic  effects, if any, these additives have been
   11  found to have or are suspected of having.
   12    S 2. Article 13-F of the public health law is amended by adding a  new
   13  section 1399-mm-1 to read as follows:
   14    S  1399-MM-1. DISCLOSURE BY MANUFACTURERS OF TOBACCO PRODUCTS. 1.  FOR
   15  THE PURPOSE OF PROTECTING THE PUBLIC HEALTH, ANY MANUFACTURER  OF  CIGA-
   16  RETTES,  SNUFF  OR  CHEWING TOBACCO SOLD IN THIS STATE SHALL PROVIDE THE
   17  DEPARTMENT WITH AN ANNUAL REPORT, IN A FORM AND AT A TIME  SPECIFIED  BY
   18  THE  DEPARTMENT,  WHICH  LISTS  FOR  EACH BRAND OF SUCH PRODUCT SOLD THE
   19  FOLLOWING INFORMATION:
   20    (A) THE IDENTITY OF ANY ADDED CONSTITUENT OTHER THAN TOBACCO OR  WATER
   21  INCLUDING  RECONSTITUTED  TOBACCO  SHEET MADE WHOLLY FROM TOBACCO, TO BE

    3    (B)  THE  NICOTINE YIELD RATINGS, WHICH SHALL ACCURATELY PREDICT NICO-
    4  TINE INTAKE FOR AVERAGE CONSUMERS, BASED ON STANDARDS TO BE  ESTABLISHED
    5  BY THE DEPARTMENT; AND
    6    (C)  THE IDENTITY AND WEIGHT OF TOXIC CONSTITUENTS IN THE WHOLE TOBAC-
    7  CO, AND FOR CIGARETTES THE IDENTITY AND WEIGHT OF TOXIC CONSTITUENTS  IN
    8  THE  MAINSTREAM  SMOKE  AND SIDESTREAM SMOKE AND A TOXICITY YIELD RATING
    9  BASED ON STANDARDS TO BE ESTABLISHED BY THE DEPARTMENT.
   10    THE DEPARTMENT SHALL INVESTIGATE HEALTH RISKS ASSOCIATED WITH EXPOSURE
   11  TO ADDED CONSTITUENTS, TOXIC CONSTITUENTS AND NICOTINE AND SHALL DEVELOP
   12  STANDARDS FOR MANUFACTURERS TO REDUCE RISKS ASSOCIATED WITH EXPOSURE  TO
   13  ADDED CONSTITUENTS, TOXIC CONSTITUENTS, AND NICOTINE.
   14    2. THE NICOTINE YIELD RATINGS SO PROVIDED, AND ANY OTHER SUCH INFORMA-
   15  TION  IN  THE ANNUAL REPORTS WITH RESPECT TO WHICH THE DEPARTMENT DETER-
   16  MINES THAT THERE IS REASONABLE SCIENTIFIC BASIS FOR CONCLUDING THAT  THE
   17  AVAILABILITY  OF  SUCH  INFORMATION COULD REDUCE RISKS TO PUBLIC HEALTH,
   18  SHALL BE PUBLIC RECORDS AND AVAILABLE TO  THE  PUBLIC  PURSUANT  TO  THE
   19  PROVISIONS OF ARTICLE SIX OF THE PUBLIC OFFICERS LAW.
   20    3. ON AND AFTER JANUARY FIRST, TWO THOUSAND THIRTEEN, NO PERSON, FIRM,
   21  OR  CORPORATION  ENGAGED  IN THE MANUFACTURE OF CIGARETTES SHALL SELL OR
   22  OFFER FOR SALE IN THIS STATE ANY CIGARETTES, SNUFF  OR  CHEWING  TOBACCO
   23  FOR  WHICH  THE  INFORMATION REQUIRED BY SUBDIVISION ONE OF THIS SECTION
   24  HAS NOT BEEN PROVIDED PURSUANT THERETO.
   25    4. WHERE A VIOLATION OF THIS ARTICLE IS ALLEGED TO HAVE OCCURRED,  THE
   26  ATTORNEY GENERAL MAY APPLY IN THE NAME OF THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW
   27  YORK  TO  THE  SUPREME  COURT OF NEW YORK ON NOTICE OF FIVE DAYS, FOR AN
   28  ORDER COMPELLING COMPLIANCE WITH THIS ARTICLE. IN  ANY  SUCH  PROCEEDING
   29  THE  COURT  MAY  IMPOSE  A  CIVIL PENALTY IN AN AMOUNT NOT TO EXCEED TEN
   30  THOUSAND DOLLARS FOR EACH VIOLATION.
   31    5. THE COMMISSIONER SHALL ANNUALLY PREPARE AND PUBLISH A REPORT  BASED
   32  UPON  THE  INFORMATION  RECEIVED  BY  THE  DEPARTMENT  PURSUANT  TO THIS
   33  SECTION, INDICATING THE RELATIVE LEVELS OF ADDED CONSTITUENTS AND  RELA-
   34  TIVE  NICOTINE  YIELD  RATINGS OF BRANDS OF CIGARETTES, SNUFF OR CHEWING
   35  TOBACCO SOLD IN THIS STATE. SUCH REPORT SHALL  ALSO  INDICATE  WHICH  OF
   36  SUCH  CONSTITUENTS  ARE  KNOWN  TO  BE  TOXIC, DESCRIPTIONS OF THE TOXIC
   37  EFFECTS, AND THE CIRCUMSTANCES UNDER WHICH SUCH EFFECTS ARE PRODUCED.
   38    S 3. This act shall take effect on the first of January next  succeed-
   39  ing the date on which it shall have become a law.
